body: When implementing this we need to take into account named layouts. So far, the `@` sign is only allowed on `.svelte` files, which would need to be softened here.
Also bumped into this issue, was confused why `LayoutLoad` wasn't appearing in `import("./$types")`. Creating a `+layout.svelte` with a `<slot/>` worked

issue.title: [breaking] `ssr/hydrate/router/prerender.default` are now configurable in `+page(.server).js` and `+layout(.server).js`
Allow layout.js without layout.svelte
issue.body:
### Describe the problem

In some cases you are not using layouts to render extra elements but rather to load shared data, or to check for permissions within a subtree.  This code resides fully in `+layout.js` or `+layout.server.js` and has no use for `+layout.svelte`.  It is however not possible to have these files in isolation and not having the `.svelte` file gives the following error:

```
node.component is not a function
TypeError: node.component is not a function
```

### Describe the proposed solution

Allow to have a `layout.js` file without `layout.svelte`.
The compiler can detect this situation and virtually inject a svelte file of the form:

```html
<slot />
```

### Alternatives considered

Actually making the `+layout.svelte` yourself, but this adds unnecessary boilerplate to the code.

### Importance

nice to have

### Additional Information

_No response_

body: Also encountered this issue with making a form action. This took me so long to realize, so an error message (at the very least) would be appreciated. (The file errors out when a +page.server.ts is present only, with the error: node.component is not a function)
Ran into this when I had a layout group without a `+layout.svelte` the error I got was `node.component is not a function`

issue.title: creating +page.server.js without +page.svelte or +layout.server.js without +layout.svelte will throw error
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

error `node.component is not a function` on @sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/server/page/render.js:82:64

### Reproduction

create path that only have `+layout.server.js` without `+layout.svelte` or `+page.server.js` without `+page.svelte` it will throw error

### Logs

```shell
node.component is not a function
TypeError: node.component is not a function
    at file:///home/my-app/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/server/page/render.js:82:64
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at render_response (file:///home/my-app/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/server/page/render.js:82:41)
    at render_page (file:///home/my-app/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/server/page/index.js:276:16)
    at runMicrotasks (<anonymous>)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)
    at async resolve (file:///home/my-app/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/server/index.js:232:17)
    at async respond (file:///home/my-app/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/server/index.js:284:20)
    at async file:///home/my-app/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/exports/vite/dev/index.js:406:22
```


### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Linux 5.15 Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS 22.04.1 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish)

    Firefox: 105.0.1
```

### Additional Information

I though its a feature and made documentation PR #7115 but @Rich-Harris said its a bug

body: Ran into this while following the docs: https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/load#input-methods-parent and it was very annoying to find out what the hell was wrong because the docs list it as valid..

issue.title: node.component... isn't a function
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Occasionally I will get a `node.component isn't a function` error, I first found it when I had a layout group without a `+layout.svelte` but then later came across when I deployed a large project to netlify (haven't found the cause for that yet)

### Reproduction

Not been able to reliably reproduce yet, hoping this issue will provide visibility to others with the problem

issue.title: options.manifest._.nodes[0] is not a function
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

If run `npm run preview` with `prerender = true` on all pages, a "options.manifest._.nodes[0] is not a function" error comes up if request a non-existent page.

### Reproduction

1. `npm create svelte@latest my-app && cd my-app && npm install`
2. Select `Skeleton project`
3. `echo "export const prerender = true" > src/routes/+layout.js`
4. `npm run build && npm run preview`
5. Open app in browser and navigate `/123`

### Logs
```Shell
TypeError: options.manifest._.nodes[0] is not a function
    at respond_with_error (file:///Users/zyxd/Developer/zyxd/issue-nodes-not-function/.svelte-kit/output/server/index.js:1771:61)
    at resolve (file:///Users/zyxd/Developer/zyxd/issue-nodes-not-function/.svelte-kit/output/server/index.js:2877:22)
    at resolve (file:///Users/zyxd/Developer/zyxd/issue-nodes-not-function/.svelte-kit/output/server/index.js:2904:34)
    at options.hooks.handle (file:///Users/zyxd/Developer/zyxd/issue-nodes-not-function/.svelte-kit/output/server/index.js:3062:59)
    at respond (file:///Users/zyxd/Developer/zyxd/issue-nodes-not-function/.svelte-kit/output/server/index.js:2902:42)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)
```

### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: macOS 13.0.1
    CPU: (10) arm64 Apple M1 Pro
    Memory: 1.04 GB / 16.00 GB
    Shell: 5.8.1 - /bin/zsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.11.0 - /opt/homebrew/bin/node
    npm: 8.19.2 - /opt/homebrew/bin/npm
  Browsers:

    Safari: 16.1
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.87 
    @sveltejs/kit: next => 1.0.0-next.543 
    svelte: ^3.44.0 => 3.53.1 
    vite: ^3.1.0 => 3.2.3
```


### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: [feat] add fallback component for layouts without one
issue.body:
Closes #5967

This was surprisingly easy

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0
